text: The Holy Trinity Church, also called the Reformation Memorial Church of the Holy Trinity) () is the largest Protestant church in Worms, Germany. It was built between 1701 and 1717.Frommer's Germany 2011, eds. Darwin Porter, Danforth Prince (Hoboken, NJ: Wily Publishing, 2011), p. 502 The baroque hall building is centrally located on the market square and is very close to the cathedral. == References == Category:Buildings and structures in Rhineland- Palatinate Category:Protestant churches in Germany Category:Worms, Germany Category:18th-century buildings and structures
title: Trinity Church, Worms
